33501.name: They're At The Post
33501.description:
The fun new game, that brings you all the excitement of the racetrack.

Each player places bets and then rolls two dice (one white and one green) to move the horses around the board. Each number on the dice represents one of the horses, the green die moves the horse forward two spaces whereas the white die only moves the horse forward 1 space.

33502.description:
The game consists of a pack of 44 cards, picturing Dan Dare and his friends from the Eagle. There are four suits (Air Transport, Weapons, Land and Sea Transport and Animals) though in each suit the highest numbered cards are Dan Dare himself (11), Miss Peabody and Sir Hubert Guest (10) and Digby (9).

The game is a two part trick-taking card game. In the first half of the game the winner of each trick gets to take a visible top card from the remainder of the deck (the loser takes a hidden card) and in the second half the cards won in the first half are used.
33502.name: Dan Dare

33503.name: Gran Hotel
33503.description:
Another Monopoly-like game.

Each player has a value scale card with 6 levels. All players start with level 1, and in many different ways their level will be changing during the game.
When the level is high, the cost for buying hotels is also high, but at the same time you make more money when other players (?)fall(?) in your hotels.

The hotels are build in different areas, and each area has a number of stars. Hotels in areas with a lot of stars will give you more money.

Box contents:

- 1 square board
- 1 dice
- 4 "meeples"
- 36 hotels (9 of each 4 different colors)
- 24 "?" cards
- 4 values scale cards
- A lot of money

33504.name: Wer spart gewinnt
33504.description: Simple children's dice game. Go around the board and pick up event cards depending on what field you get. Either get or pay money. For example: You get your pocket-money (5 DM). You help your dad washing the car (3 DM). You have lost your pencil. (2 DM) You buy an ice (1 DM)... If get around back to the start field you can put money on your savings book for which you yield interests on special fields. The winner is the first player to amount 200 DM.

33505.name: Logos
33505.description:
From the Greek word Logos, meaning "the word", this game combines elements of a crossword building word game with added dimensions of spelling, defining, synonym and antonym categories. A roll of the die determines which category is played on your turn. For 2-6 players, individually or in teams. The game can easily be adapted to "house rules" so that any level of player can learn and enjoy.

Perhaps you can spell the word matrix (n) but can you define it for double point value?
What is a good synonym for riddle (n) – how about puzzle (n) for the premium point value?
8 wooden letter tiles to start the common crossword puzzle – you can exchange up to 2 tiles
Did you know that a gimlet as a noun is not only a drink but also a tool for cutting? Use lesser known definitions to your advantage when playing and confuse your opponents!!!




Full details at: http://logosgame.com/

33507.description:
From the Designer: Legendary Heroes the gap between traditional wargaming and role-playing games. Legendary Heroes marks the beginning of the new Role-Playing Lite system where players can create personal characters and travel through the world interacting with the people that live there.

Players can rise from humble beginnings and through wits and weapons advance to legendary status. Cast potent spells or swing a mighty sword, it's up to you!"

Tables included in the game allow the game to be played solo or up to as many players as desired cooperatively or competitively.

Home Page: http://www.twohourwargames.com/wahearandad.html
33507.name: Warrior Heroes: Armies & Adventures

33509.name: Peter Jones' Big Business
33509.description:
Peter Jones’ Big Business is a family board game for two or more players aged eight and up. Over six rounds encompassing the key areas of setting up and running a business, players are randomly issued with a business, such as ‘Best Knickers’ (a retailer of high class undies) and ‘Head Office (a chain of hairdressers).

The object of the game is to beat other players in a race to collect the right kind of staff and make the most money, during rounds including ‘Pitch to Peter,’ ‘Number Cruncher’ and ‘Spot the Bull’. At different times in the game you can ‘Hire, Fire or Trade’ employees, and choose to negotiate with Peter over certain decisions.

33510.name: Unterwegs in Deutschland mit dem Zug
33510.description:
The players travel through Germany with their trains. They have to visit specific cities, answer master questions there, and encounter events in between. Movement allowance is defined by answering trivia questions of all sorts. Several joker cards help on difficult questions.

If a player currently doesn't have a destination card, he gets one; correct guessing the city from its description allows a first move in its direction.
On later turns, the player has to answer a trivia question; depending on the difficulty level chosen, a correct answer gives 2 - 6 movement points.
If he encounters a random event space in between, movement stops, and he follows the directions on the event card.
When he reaches the destination city, he has to answer a master question (multiple choice).

The first player that has encountered at least 3 events and correctly answered 3 master questions wins the game.

33511.description:
This one hit wonder was the only publication by War-Oboe Publications. These ASL scenarios are designed for multiple players with up to 8 players on a side. Most scenarios require at least 4 players. Many scenarios feature the uncertainty of both sides not knowing what the other sides Order of Battle and or Victory Conditions are until the games end.

The counter art used represents some of the icons used by the Germans in WWII to represent military units.

Contents:
El Alamein, Egypt, 26 October 1942:
Players: 4-6 total, two to three per side.
Scenarios: 1

Kursk, Russia, 12 July 1943
Players: 8, four per side.
Scenarios: 4

Normandy, France, 6 June 1944
Players: 16, 8 per side.
Scenarios included: 8

Saipan, Marianas, 7 July 1944
players: 4, 2 per side.
Scenarios: 1

Iwo Jima, 25 February 1945
Players: 4, two per side.
Scenarios included: 2

Tournament Scenarios
Buna, Papua New Guinea, 1 December 1942
Papua, New Guinea, 8 December 1942
Leyte, Philippines, 28 October 1944.
33511.name: Monster Pack #1

33512.description:
From the Publisher's website:

Timmes' Orchard - The All American 82nd Airborne Division is a Variant Historical Module for owners of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 and/or Paratrooper: ASL Module 2 that tells the story of the Battle of Normandy from the perspective of the 82nd Airborne Division, the American paratroopers tasked with protecting hte Utah Beach exits from the Hitlerian boast that the invaders would be ... driven back into into the sea... and the efforts of the tyrant's generals to carry out that wish.

Contents:

First edition: A 28"x32" single sheet map. Second edition: A 22"x34" two-piece color map on heavyweight stock
A historical and scenario summary booklet plus variant rules
8 Scenarios , one of which requires ownership of All American: Kellam's Bridge
2 Solitaire ASL scenarios.
33512.name: All American: Timmes' Orchard

33513.name: Laskemme yhdessä
33513.description:
Laskemme yhdessä (We count together)

In this fun game you'll learn elementary mathematics and numbers 1-100 in 4 different languages: Finnish, Swedish, English and German. The game can be also used as a "number dictionary".

boardgamecompilation: Neuroshima Hex! Żetony promocyjne – zestaw I
33514.description:
The Mad Bomber is a single tile supplement for Neuroshima Hex!. It was given away, with rules only in Polish, to participants at a Neuroshima Hex tournament during the game convention Pionek in Gliwice, Poland 2007-12-08.

The Mad Bomber is a single unit who belongs to no player nor army. He starts the game on the center of the map. If he receives any damage during a battle, he immediately explodes in the same phase, causing a point of damage to units in all 6 neighboring hexes (except headquarters). He then will be drawn as the first tile by the next player in turn order after the one who caused the bomber to be hit, and that player can deploy him on the map again. If more than one player hits him in the same initiative phase of the battle, then he is knocked out of the game.

The Mad Bomber II works slightly differently: he starts the game off the board. Either player can then, by discarding a tile in addition to their usual discard, place the Bomber anywhere on the board. Once he is eliminated, he may then be placed again by either player, as previously detailed.

Expands:

Neuroshima Hex!
33514.name: Neuroshima Hex! Mad Bomber

33516.name: Fish On!
33516.description: "The fishing game for young and old." Created by a resident of Dowagiac, Michigan (home of the Heddon lures), Fish On! is a simple game that uses spinners and cards. Players spin Spinner #1 to see if a fish is caught. If caught, then the player spins Spinner #2 to see which species (five possible) and draws a card (from Stack #1) to determine how many pounds and points the fish is worth. Final results are determined by Spinner #3 (results include throwing the fish back, landing the fish, or drawing a card from Stack #2). The game includes a board (with the spinners, two decks of dedicated cards, and a pad of score sheets. Game production and distribution was generally limited to Dowagiac.

33517.name: El juego del siglo
33517.description:
A trivia game that rewards boldness, strategy and luck.

The questions are about significant events of the twentieth century.

After know a historical fact, before the real question is known, it should be bet on the table about the possibility of answering correctly. You will be able to guess the question? Without risk there is no gain.

33518.description:
From the box:

"Uncle Jimmy, let's play some baseball."
"OK Jack, batter up!"
Baseball fans everywhere understand a solo homer, a two run dinger and a grand slam. However, during the early days of baseball, a three run homer was called a JIMMYjack.
JIMMYjack BASEBALL
Paying tribute to a special relationship and the always exciting three run homer.
Each JIMMYjack game box includes two decks of game cards, one game board, one scoring pad, two dice, 18 baseball tokens and one JIMMYjack Baseball ground rules and instruction manual.

Ages 8 and Up.
33518.name: Jimmyjack Baseball

33519.name: Mythical Beasts: Minotaur's Maze
33519.description: A 2-4 player game where players attempt to escape from a maze populated by mythological creatures. The prime motivator of the game is a spinner embedded in the game board with both numbers (1-4) and weapons/accessories (Strength, Reflective Shield, Pegasus, Cloak of Invisibility, fire, sword, arrows, or Power of the Gods) represented on its rim. Players take turns spinning to determine how far they can move. Upon entering any creature's space (except the Sphinx or Minotaur) the player spins to determine combat. Landing on an appropriate weapon defeats the creature, with the reflective shield defeating the gorgon and basilisk and so on. If the player enters the Sphinx' space, he must answer a riddle to advance, while entering the minotaurs space requires the draw of a card to decide combat. The first player to escape the maze wins. The game includes a book detailing 15 mythological beasts from around the world, 15 painted plastic miniatures, 4 minotaur cards and a game board.

33520.name: Run For President
33520.description:
The basic rules for playing Run For President are simple:

1. Starting with four random state cards each, the players take turns asking another player for a state touching (geographically) one they are holding. If they get the card they get to keep asking. If not, they draw the top state from the deck.

2. When a player gets four states that are connected geographically, he or she puts the cards down and those electoral votes are theirs. The player claims the votes by taking the states from the puzzle board.

The game continues until all the states are won. The player with the most electoral votes is the winner.

33521.description:
Game was described in an issue of the General, covering the Avalon Hill game called Siege of Jerusalem.

Evidently, AH acquired the rights. The AH version is, according to one of the designers, is "...in many respects, quite different from its Historical Perspectives ancestor....New information, or just new ways of looking at things, manifest themselves. Don Greenwood, to his credit, instituted most of the improvements. But, the core remained...".

Evidently, the game was first sold at Orgins II in 1976, and a 2nd edition in 1980. 4,000? copies published?
33521.name: The Siege of Jerusalem, 70 A.D.
boardgamepodcastepisode: Guns, Dice, Butter Episode XI: Jan 8, 2013

33522.description:
The first book in the "Worlds at War" series, which was never expanded upon further in this edition of the game. This book takes the conflict from the other planets in the solar system back down to a post-apocalyptic Earth, with detailed entries for all four of the Tribes of Earth (the Sons of Rasputin, the Templars, the Lutheran Triad, and Crescentia). It also gives entries for the troops from the Megacorporations (Capitol, Bauhaus, Imperial, Mishima, and Cybertronic), the Brotherhood, and the Dark Legion that are to be found on Dark Eden. Also included are rules for taking Tribes of Earth units in corporate armies, and bringing corporate armies down to Earth.

Really, this book is meant to be used on its own, with the rules (but not the army lists) from the original Warzone rulebook. However rules for including the full factions found in the Warzone rulebook were included in Dark Eden.
33522.name: Warzone: Dark Eden

33523.description:
This book expanded significantly on the Imperial megacorporation, adding more Wolfbanes to those found in the base rulebook. As well, it adds new troop types, and personalities to the other corporate, Brotherhood, and Dark Legion armies. It also adds some counters, templates, force sheets, new rules, rules corrections, weapons, abilities, and more.

A copy of Warzone - A Fast and Furious Miniatures Battle Game 1st edition is required to use this book.
33523.name: Warzone: Casualties of War

33524.name: Seven Summits
33524.description:
Seven Summits is essentially a series of four games played with the same theme and board. It was published in four parts in Jeux sur un Plateau magazine, issues 30, 32, 34, and 36. The game set was developed in collaboration with Josep Pujante, who has climbed the eight highest mountains in the world. In each case, once the designated number of peaks has been reached, the player with the most points wins.

Online play

Jeux sur un Plateau (turn-based)

33525.name: Débarquement à Narvik
33525.description:
Combat in Norway
Germans army against allies army in 1940 around Narvik.

There are different Phases :
Méteo
Air
Naval
Ground

Turn : 12 days and 6 turns/day
Rules : 11 pages with the different tables
2 mapboards : A3

Counters are to be cut and to be stuck.

This game was published in the magazine "Le journal du Stratège - Spécial Norvège" on October 1991

33527.name: Drive-In
33527.description:
The movie-theater game from S&R from the end of the 1940's.

The game comes with thick cardboard movie-theaters which have a wooden stand nailed onto them.
Into these stands, cards can be slotted-in, depicting various fictitious movies in comical style.

When every player has drawn such a card dice rolling begins with several specially made dice.

The movies generate different income(represented by colorful and thick cardboard chips), and also have different rental price in order to keep on showing particular movie in your own theater.

Under certain circumstances you can drag a movie star into your theater who is represented by a small little red car and who enhances your income.

Game ends when all movies provided with the game have been shown.

Pure dice-luck, but if you're prepared to get into it you're rewarded by pure nostalgia, the components and artwork. One of the most sought-after S&R games !

33528.name: Speedway
33528.description:
A game from the Heydays of British Speedway Motorsports.

A colourful racetrack-oval on the gameboard has to be circled 4 times as in real speedway.

Depicted on the board center is a real photo from a stadium racing scene, the rest is graphic artwork from the times.

Pure roll-and-move with hazard spaces, but nice artwork and time witness-feeling make it not-to-be-missed by the speedway and motorsport enthusiast!

33529.name: Vilda Vikingar
33529.description:
Vilda Vikingar.

Who will best lead their Vikings on a dangerous trip and defeat other Vikings and bring back the gold? Use your bone to move your Viking and battle with the struggle cards.

A family game that will give you a lot of excitement and action.

Contents:
1 Boardgame
80 goldtiles
12 struggle cards
12 Vikings
4 playing bones
1 rule sheet

33530.name: Super Test (1975-1995: La Aventura de la Libertad)
33530.description:
A trivia game about history (mainly Spanish).

Each player takes the role of a Spanish minister and tries to be the first to get through 240 squares.
In the way you can find some special events, and you will always be asked a question about politics or history.

The dice has a different color for each side, representing the different type of questions:
Yellow: Sports and spectacle.
Blue: Spanish politics.
Pink: Spanish society.
Green: Science and art.
Red: International history.

The questions are from different ages depending on the area where the player is: 1975-1980, 1981-1985, 1986-1990, 1991-1995.

Box contents:

- 1 board game (240 squares, representing Spanish and world history).
- 9 "mini-ministers", but with only 6 feet (only 6 simultaneous players).
- a big set of question cards.
- some special "challenge" cards.
- a box with separators for the different ages of the questions.

33531.description: The 'Stock Up' Supplement is a Web-exclusive for Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game and features a new scenario and ten new game cards. All pieces are printed on the same high-quality card stock as the boardgame. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature all new artwork and some new game mechanics, such as 'Sacrifice'.
33531.name: Last Night on Earth 'Stock Up' Supplement
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

33532.description: On behalf of Moto-King Racing, we would like to welcome you to the sport of kings. Moto-King is dedicated to all riders and fans alike. This game has been created to promote motocross racing. It's a learning tool that takes bench racing a step further. So whether you are a youth or a vet, get set to go racing. Go For It! 2-5 player game that comes with profile cards, playing cards, medical cards, moto buckers, die cast motocross bikers, and a nicely designed board.
33532.name: Moto-King

33533.name: RUSSIA: The Soviet-German War
33533.description:
RUSSIA: THE SOVIET-GERMAN WAR presents the war on the Eastern Front, from its beginning in 1941 until the end in 1945, in five modules. By the series’ completion, its ten maps, scaled at 10 miles per hex, will cover the area east to west from Moscow to Warsaw and north to south from southern Finland to Grozny.

The first three modules—entitled MOSCOW, STALINGRAD, and LENINGRAD respectively, all contain a variety of scenarios beginning in late 1941, with the fourth module, BARBAROSSA, adding the final maps and beginning the war from the jump-off date of June 22, 1941. Module #5 completes the series with a set of campaign and optional rules.

RUSSIA has several highly specific design goals, all of which will be kept firmly in mind as the modules in the series are under development.

1. The emphasis on the entire series will be on playability—and we mean that. To this end, we will always be willing, during development, to chop out detail that impedes the speed of play—and we are focusing on the major defining elements of each campaign rather than the tiny details. In addition, the game will do everything possible not only to eliminate large stacks, but to provide hexes large enough to provide for comfortable counter placement.

2. Play will alternate quickly between the two sides. Not only will interactivity occur while each player is conducting his moves, this is not a game in which one player moves all his units and then the other player does. Instead, play will switch constantly from one player to the other, and the game system is being designed from the ground up to eliminate downtime.

3. The complexity rating of the modules will never rise above a rating of 5, and even with the campaign module will not rise above 6. This is a promise. These ratings assume that EFS and OCS have complexity ratings of 8 (as a point of comparison).

4. The game will make it impossible, at the strategic level, for the Soviet player to simply run away from the German army. Drawing from the research in David Glantz’s series of studies of the war, the RUSSIA series forces the Soviet player to think in terms of frequent—even continual—attacks, beginning very early after the initial attack. The Soviet player can ignore this requirement, but if he does his “War Experience” (as the system is known) will never increase, and he cannot win the game. The Soviet player must learn that victory in battle means something much different for him than it does for the German, and the that he must be aggressive in attack from the earliest days of the war.

5. The system will provide a variety of ways for each player to win, but also a number of ways for players to lose. Juggling one against the other will provide a constant challenge.

The first module of RUSSIA will ship in May of 2009, with each additional module appearing at roughly one-year intervals. We plan to unveil the campaign module at Monstercon in 2013.

33534.name: Speak Skate
33534.description:
From the publisher's site:

Speak Skate is a cross-cultural ESL speaking game for learners of English.
During the game students demonstrate their English communication skills through interactive play. For beginner, intermediate, & advanced!

Everyday vocabulary is put to practical use. The team to cross the finish line first WINS!!!!!

Contents: 2 Pawns, 3 Decks of Cards, 1 Game Board, 1 Custom Die, 1 Sand Timer.

Ages 6 and up, 4-40 Players

33535.name: DFL
33535.description:
From the game's main website:

Introducing Dice Football League the action-packed board game where every roll of the dice can mean the difference between winning and losing.

From single games to entire seasons, Dice Football League will provide hours of fun for family and friends, young and old!

You can play Dice Football League right out of the box...no complicated set-ups, no 1000 page user manuals, just pop open the box, set up the board, and you're good to go. Frat-parties, kid's birthday parties, fun get-togethers, whatever the occasion, Dice Football League is a great way to have fun. Play it once, and you'll want to play again and again.

33536.name: Conclave
33536.description:
From the publisher's site:
From Priest to Cardinal...Become Pope in a Day!

Play the Politics of Papal Selection & Examine the Hierarchy & Bureaucracy of the Roman Catholic Church that has existed for two Thousand Years!

Discover the History & Mysteries surrounding the Vatican. Study its Shocking Story, its Contributions, Doctrines, & Teachings! Uncover its Murky Past, its Violent History, its Bizarre practices & Strange Customs! Learn about Religion, Theology, Biblical and Intriguing Papal History!

Discover the Churches’ Strange Trivia & Historical Facts often unknown to many, and ignored by most!
All this and much, much, more when you Play CONCLAVE! The Game of the Papacy!

2 or More Players, Teens to Adult

Components:
- 1 Game Board
- 1 Deck of Trivia Cards
- 1 Deck of Penitence Cards
- 1 Deck of Indulgence Cards
- 6 Playing Pieces
- 1 Custom Papal Die
- 1 Sand Timer
- 1 Page of Easy Instructions

33537.name: Trollspelet
33537.description:
Trollspelet (English, The Troll Game) is a Swedish children's game. Each player controls a happy-go-lucky troll. The object of the game is to find the lucky beads that are hidden in the forest. Opposition comes from a naughty bat who causes havoc among the beads. but there's also help to be found - a magic fish swims in a nearby pond.

The first player to collect all his/her beads and return to the troll nest wins.

33539.name: Exact Change
33539.description:
Exact Change - Where having exact change wins the game.

In exact change players add up or subtract from the money amount to win the pot. Players add one coin at a time and you strategically try to be the last player to put the coin down. If you are you win that amount.

The player with all the money wins.

33540.name: The 80's - 90's Combo Game
33540.description:
From publisher's page:

The Combo Game features 1,200 all-new questions about 80’s and 90’s nostalgia so it’s perfect for re-charging your copy of The 80’s Game® and The 90’s Game®. Or use The Combo Game’s travel-sized game board and game pieces to play on the road! Either way, get more great trivia about Cheers, Aerosmith, The Naked Gun and Guns N’ Roses. For 2 to 5 players or teams of teenagers and adults.

33541.description:
Friedland 1807 marks the 20th battle of the Jours de Gloire game series. The module, available in English and French, completes the "1807 Franco-Russian battles pack" that started with Eylau 1807 (Vae Victis #77).

The game includes two historical scenarios:
» The Two Day Battle, starting the evening of June 13 with only one unit on the map, all others arriving as reinforcements (16 turns)
» The 14th of June Afternoon Battle (5 turns)

SYSTEM: Jours de Gloire Series (JDG)
- scale = 297 m/hex;
- time = 75 min/GT;
- strength = 200 men/SP.
33541.name: Friedland 1807

33543.description:
The first expansion for Epic Armageddon, it had a limited print run before Games Workshop decided that all future releases for this game system would be web based only. It can now be freely downloaded from http://www.games-workshop.com/gws/content/article.jsp?catId=...;categoryId=1100008&section=&aId=4900003

This supplement introduced Eldar, Imperial Guard Siege Regiments and Feral Orks into the 4th edition epic system Epic Armageddon

Expands:

Epic Armageddon
33543.name: Epic Swordwind

33544.description:
The book Codex Titanicus is a suplement for both Adeptus Titanicus and first edition Space Marine. It introduced additional races such as Orks and Eldar to the game. It also contained eratta and corrected a few minor problems with incompatability between the two previous games.

Expands

Space Marine
33544.name: Codex Titanicus

33545.name: NetEpic
33545.description:
NetEpic is a 6 mm tabletop wargame of science fiction combat, set in the Games Workshop Warhammer
40,000 universe. Two or more players each command an army and battle for supremacy.

The game is a collaborative open source continuation of the spirit of 2nd edition Space Marine by the NetEpic Discussion Group that have released several versions, the current version of the rules being 5.0. Rule are freely downloadable from the Epicentre http://www.netepic.org/netepic.html

33547.name: Casino in Space
33547.description:
(From rules insert)
Brief Idea of the Game is to get the excitement of real Casino life without losing your shirt or your house.
Poor or rich all can have lots of excitement for long hours with this incredible Game.



Players move around a monopoly style board by rolling dice, and play the casino game that they land on. Goal is to reach $10,000 and land on the Finish Line.

33548.description: Based on the best selling children's picture books by Jane O'Connor. 2 to 4 players Ages 3 and up take turns spinning the spinner to collect fancy items of clothing to dress up their dolls with. The first to finish dressing up their doll wins. No reading required.
33548.name: Fancy Nancy Dress-Up Game

33549.name: Monopoly: Horse Lover's Edition
33549.description: Monopoly with a horse theme that involves buying up your favorite horse breeds. For 2 to 6 players aged 8 and up, it comes with 6 pewter tokens (boot, apple, horse, trailer, horse shoe, and saddle).

33550.name: High School Musical 2: Star Dazzle Card Game
33550.description:
From the Box Cover:

The card game that lets you show off your talents and how much you know about High School Musical 2. Perhaps you can even fool your friends into thinking you know more than you do.

33551.name: Kansas City Scene
33551.description:
Kansas City Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in the KS/MO city. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from the city.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Have you ever wanted to own the Kansas City Chiefs, Macy's, the Kansas City Star, or run the Board of Trade? Now is your chance by playing Kansas City Scene.

33552.name: San Antonio & Austin Scene
33552.description:
San Antonio & Austin Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in the Texas cities. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from those cities.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Wheel and deal in the oil industry, command an air force base, persuade an ethnic leader, and attempt to influence a politician or two - all in San Antonio & Austin Scene.

33553.name: Cincinnati Scene
33553.description:
Cincinnati Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in Cincinnati, OH. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from the city.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Have you ever wanted to own the Cincinnati Reds, Procter & Gamble, Indian Hill, or run the Cincinnati Enquirer? Now is your chance by playing Cincinnati Scene.

33554.name: New Orleans Scene
33554.description:
New Orleans Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in New Orleans, LA. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from the city.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games Series.

From the publisher: Wheel and deal on the Waterfront, befriend a glamorous socialite, explore the French Quarter, and retain a shrewed lawyer to stay out of trouble - all part of the New Orleans Scene.

33555.name: Denver Scene
33555.description:
Denver Scene is a Monopoly variant taking place in set in Denver, CO. The board spaces are late 1970s-era business from Denver.

Part of the Hansen's City Scene Games line.

From the publisher: Influence the Water Board, make the Canadian connection, join the right club, and deal with the old-moneyed businesses - all part of the Denver Scene.

33556.name: Utah on Board
33556.description: Utah on Board is a Monopoly clone based on the state of Utah. Board squares are replaced with landmarks, tourist attractions, and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit Utah based charities.

33558.name: Hi-Ho! Santa Claus Game
33558.description:
You use a spinner to go around the board, trimming the tree in this old Christmas holiday-themed game.

OBJECT: To be the first player to put his 8 colored balls and Santa Claus on the Christmas Tree.

Players spin the spinner once each turn. If the spinner lands on his color, he may put one of his colored balls in the hole on the Christmas tree that shows the matching color. If the spinner lands on the tree, he must remove one of his colored balls from the tree. If a player spins Santa Claus before he has 8 balls on the tree, he can spin again. Once a player has all his 8 balls on the tree, he spins on his turn for Santa Claus. When he has all 8 balls and spins Santa Claus, he yells out "Hi Ho! Santa Claus!", thus winning the game!

boardgamecompilation: The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
33559.description:
This expansion to the base game is available in the Spielbox magazine 6/07.
They are also included in The Pillars of the Earth Expansion Set! (Mayfair Games edition only!) and in the German special edition

The new craftsmen cards in this expansion are:

Beggar (Bettler)
Day Laborer (Tagelöhner)
Tinsmith (Zinngießer)
Goldsmith (Goldschmied)
Market Warden (Marktwart)
Gardener (Gartenbauer)




From the publisher:

"Here are six new craftsmen you can add to your Pillars of the Earth games! They are compatible with both the basic game and the expansion. These craftsmen are mixed together with the ones in the basic game (and the expansion if you are using it). But the number of craftsmen available is not increased. In 2-4 player games, only four craftsmen are available each round, as normal (two on the spaces in Shiring, and two below the board with the resource cards). In 5 or 6 player games, there are five craftsmen each round (three below the board). Before the game begins, randomly remove one craftsman from each round, and return them unseen to the box."

Expands:

The Pillars of the Earth




Buy Microbadges

Pillars of the Earth Fan


Pillars of the Earth - I pimped my cathedral
33559.name: The Pillars of the Earth: New Craftsmen

33560.name: Pug-I-Lo
33560.description: The Pug-I-Lo Boxing Board Game was published by the Pug-I-Lo Game Company of Zullinger PA in 1960. The box claims that the game is about the Complete game of Boxing. You are the Commisioner, Manager and Fighter in this game The game comes with Play Money and Playing Cards and was designed by Marvin Ogle

33561.name: Kokoa kuva
33561.description:
Game for children Ages 4 and up.

Kokoa kuva (Build a picture) is a nice game full of funny animal pictures. One animal picture is formed of two cards. In the game you search the cards and then you can build the picture.

It's a colorful memory game that even the youngest in the family can win. Precise observations and good memory are keys to victory.

By combining cards you can create 552 funny animals like "mousebat" or "fishduck".

33562.name: De Kolonisten van Catan: Wegwerpcatan
33562.description:
Wegwerpcatan ("disposable Catan") is a free promotional version of Settlers of Catan, given away by Dutch publisher 999 Games.

The game is completely made of paper and can be used a few times. Rules are simplified: no cards are used in this version, no robber. The player who gets to 7 points wins.

Instead of dice, Wegwerpcatan uses a spinner which you have to assemble yourself. Every player has a set of tiles to rotate and represent the number of resources you own or gain. The board layout is fixed, as are the positions of the starting settlements and roads.

33563.name: Deckarspelet
33563.description: Deckarspelet (English, the Detective's game) is a card game for children based on the popular books and television shows about Lassemajas detektivbyrå (English, Lassemajas detective agency).

33564.name: Japanese Task Force 2: Carrier Battles in the Pacific, 1944
33564.description:
Blind system carrier warfare in Pacific Ocean using inverted counters and dummies.

The designer of this game is " Easy & Exciting Game (EEG) wargame design coterie".

33565.name: Bruce Lee
33565.description:
Old Polish game inspired by simple computer version of Bruce Lee game. Even on the boardgame box is written "Bruce Lee - Computer Game without computer".

In fact this is classic roll and move game. Bruce Lee explores Abby levels, fights encountered enemies, and tries to complete four mission objectives. Bruce Lee can use some equipment, and use special moves-spells.

When there is more than one player in game, everyone leads his own Bruce Lee, or some players are ninja leaders, and try to disturb Lee in his quest.

33566.name: Junior-Cop
33566.description:
A player discovers that the crook wears blue trousers and has a beard during the "crook spinner" turns on. He further thinks that the crook wore boots and had a pocket torch with him.
The active player correspondingly puts his four search items on these four features of his "Search Table".
In the evaluation phase the players check his features with the crook card. He will notice that the trousers and the beard were right, but boot and pocket torch wrong. Result: The policeman in the game moves two fields forward.

Goal of the game is to catch the crook before others do.

33567.description:
Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing-Shopping Set "is designed to help your child learn about earning, saving, and shopping wisely." The set contains 3 Main Games and 2 Introductory Games

The Introductory games introduce the board and cards to younger children.

Game 1 Fun to Earn: Uses the bottom half of the Board. Players take Job Cards from the Home space to their respective Earning Places and trade them for a Sesame Street Coupon. The first player to save 3 Coupons wins.

Game 2 Shop and Swap: Uses the top half of the Board. Players get Shopping List Cards from the Home space, move to the correct Store, and pay the listed Coupon for the correct Item. The first player to complete 3 Shopping trips wins.

Game 3 Big Bird's Surprise Birthday Party: This Combines the ideas of game 1 and 2. Players earn Coupons by completing Jobs, and then buy the items from their Shopping Lists. The first player to bring 2 items Home for Big Bird's Party wins.
33567.name: Sesame Street Preschool Games for Growing: Shopping

33568.name: Candy Land: Fun on the Run
33568.description:
From the publisher: "Every child’s first game in a new compact size for fun on the run! Move along the candy path and be first to reach the Candy Castle and win the game! No reading required to play."

The change for this travel game from the traditional game is the inclusion of a spinner to determine movement instead of the usual cards.

Re-implements:

Candy Land

33569.name: Wildcraft!
33569.description:
Here's the Story...

Grandma needs huckleberries to bake a pie. You and your cousins embark on an adventure up the mountain to collect berries as well as herbs she uses.

Will you all harvest the right plants to help with the trouble you run into along the way?

Will you make it back before nightfall?

The only way to win is by helping each other out.

Wildcraft! teaches you 25 important edible and medicinal plants and their uses in mostly first aid situations. (Wildcrafting is the harvesting of wild plants)

It also teaches team work, for you will rely on each other’s knowledge of plants and good fortune to make it to the Huckleberry Patch and safely back to Grandma’s.

Wildcraft! is a great introduction to the world of edible and medicinal herbs for children of ALL ages.

It’s a beautifully illustrated, nature based, cooperative game created in the tradition of the classic board games.

33570.description:
Children's game consisting of a central game board with 9 different illustrations, and 36 tiles that each have one of those illustrations on them. The players take turns picking a tile and placing it in front of them, where it has to touch a previous tile horizontally or vertically, as shown on the central board. The first to get all 9 wins.

A variant has the players place the tiles directly on the central game board and try to form three-in-a-row.
33570.name: Abracadabra

33571.name: Futebol S.A.
33571.description:
In this game players act as technical/owner of football clubs.
Buying the best players and putting them on the field in the best way to defeat their opponents. So recruiting new fans for his club.

33572.description:
Wargaming Battles of the American War of Independence.
Fast rules for quick and dirty play.

Originally published in Wargames Illustrated No. 1, Sept 1987.
Available here: http://www.wfgamers.org.uk/resources/callan/lfas.htm
33572.name: Loose Files and American Scramble

33573.name: Scrabble Poker
33573.description: Use Scrabble tiles printed on cards to make words and place bets with either seven card stud or Hold 'Em style. Package includes a deck of 66 cards. Deluxe set includes 100 cards and a set of four-color poker chips.

33574.name: 1789: Le Jeu de la Révolution Francaise
33574.description:
Game of the French Revolution. The map depicts Paris in 1789. Players have to obtain "certificats de civisme" by taking part in historical events (like storming the Bastille).

By the same designers as La Révolution Francaise (Azure Wish).

33575.description:
What if game

The Libyan Army, GUNT forces and Islamic legion against the French Army, Chadian forces and united Zairoise forces in TChad in 1983.

1 hex : 35 km
1 turn : 24 h
15 turns
1 mapboard : A3

Rules : 8 pages with different tables

Counters are to be cut out and to be stuck

This game was published in the French magazine "Le journal du Stratège" for July, August, September 1990
33575.name: TCHAD Manta 83

33576.description:
Wargame on the U.S. led invasion of Grenada in 1983.
Solo game
The player controls US forces

Turn : 8
Rules 3 pages
1 mapboard : A4
Counters are to be cut and to be gone up (76 counters)

This game was published in the magazine "Le journal du stratège" n° 58/59 in 1991.
33576.name: Urgent fury

33577.name: Hobble-de-hoy!
33577.description:
A Hobble-de-hoy is which one of these:

1. 17th century cabinetmaker's tool used for drilling peg holes in hard woods.

2. A young shepherd.

3. An affectionate greeting between crippled sailors.

4. Nonsense, confusion. Also a stew of vegetables, meat, and broth; hotchpotch.

5. An awkward, callow youth.

6. A wooden toy of colonial times; currently still made in remote mountain communities.

7. A mariner's cry when a whale becomes entangled in a harpoon line.

8. Trade name for a breakfast cereal made from a species of seaweed.

Well, which one?

Hobble-de-hoy! is a published version of an old parlor game, Dictionary. It consists of a single hardbound book, a little over 9" high (23 cm). The book contains complete instructions, a word list of 1001 words, and, in the back of the book, definitions from the Oxford English Dictionary for the 1001 words (reprinted with permission).

The book can be opened from either end - flip it over, and it appears to be right-side up from either side. One side brings you to the word list, the other to the definition list. Each word and definition are numbered so you can match them up easily.

As in the traditional game, players take turn finding an obscure word and announcing it to the group. Everyone writes down a definition for the word, while the player in charge writes down the official definition. The player in charge of the word then shuffles the definitions, reads them through once, then reads them again. Players voting for the correct definition get 2 points, while players whose word was selected as correct by someone else get 1 point for each selection.

The word list is a very interesting selection of some of the more obscure words in the Oxford English Dictionary. In the parlor game, a player has to thumb through a dictionary looking for an obscure word. In this book, you won't recognize at least 98% of the words! The title of the game is one such word, meaning an awkward, callow youth. (Did you get that right?) Some of the lovelier sounding words chosen include quemeful, poculary, bewscher, dedolence, cawquaw, wicopy, timwhisky, etc. And did you know there's a word that has the definition, "Excessive use of the letter R"?

33578.name: Eendenjacht
33578.description:
From the back of the box


The aim of the game is to shoot down the ducks of your colour.
Put balls into your handset according to the colour of your choice.
Press the house in the center of the turntable to start the game
Shoot to knock down the ducks of your colour as they swirl around. Beware! Do not knock down the other coloured ducks as your opponents will have the advantages!
The first person to shoot down all the ducks of his colour is the winner

33579.description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module covers the games "Fire in the East", "Scorched Earth", and "Urals". It contains 8 new counters for use with the new logistics system.
33579.name: Master Europa 101: Eastern Front

33580.description:
This book Space Marine Battles is a supplement for 2nd edition Space Marine. It is a compilation of articles from White Dwarf Magazine split into four sections:

Tactics
Battle Reports
New Rules
Modeling Workshop




The new rules introduced in this book included Daemon Engines of Tzeentch, Epic Personalities (Unique Characters for the game), Additional Titans & Garguants (these rules were superceded when Titan Legions was released) and Assult (rules for attacking fortifications)

Expands

Space Marine
33580.name: Space Marine Battles

33581.name: Mwahahaha!
33581.description:
Mwahahaha! is a resource management card game of Mad Scientists and Global Domination for 2-5 players. You assume the role of an evil genius who builds a criminal empire and constructs a doomsday device with which to cow a trembling humanity. But you're not the only one with grand machinations. Other players rival you for absolute mastery. He who completes his device first and collects the highest ransom is declared the winner — and ruler of the world!

Players choose the doomsday device that they intend to build - keeping it hidden from their opponents until they are ready to unleash it on an unsuspecting humanity. They build up the resources needed to activate the machine by playing and drawing cards whilst using minion cards to steal resources from other players and protect their own.

Once a player's device is ready they can threaten a city with it. If the city surrenders the player will gain resources towards building the next stage of their machine. If the city refuses to surrender then the player has to choose the humiliation of backing down or to activate the machine - thus destroying it.

Each stage of the machine has a grander target, the winner is the player who forces the whole world to surrender.

33582.name: Fast Mail
33582.description: The game consists of a game board, spinner and six tokens. There are three tokens for each player, representing a Fast Mail train, an Accommodation train , and a Freight train. Certain "rules of the road" apply (e.g. A Freight train must wait on a siding until a Fast Mail passes). The object is to be the first player to move all of your trains from one station to another.

33583.name: Folko-Boks
33583.description:
Folko-Boks is a boxing-themed abstract pure strategy game. The game lasts 10 rounds in a ring of 36 squares, randomly initialized with numbered chits. In each round, players move their boxers like a chess knight, removing the numbered marker from the square they left. The boxer who moves onto a higher numbered square wins that round. Being unable to move causes a knockout loss.

Folko-Boks was included as a free game in issue 4 of the Polish board gaming magazine Świat Gier Planszowych ("World of Boardgames") published December 2007.

The game acknowledges some inspiration from an earlier game by Sid Sackson, probably Paper Boxing.
There is a somewhat similar game Joust on an 8x8 grid.

33584.description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module covers the game Second Front. It contains 143 new counters for use with the logistics system.
33584.name: Master Europa 102: Western Front – Invasion

33585.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the games "Fall of France" & "Their Finest Hour". It contains 19 new counters for use with the logistics system, 3 for the German OOB, and 49 for use with the naval system . It also includes Orders Of Battle (OOB) that allow a scenario showing the Western Front from Sept. 1939 on to be explored.
33585.name: Master Europa 103: Western Front – Blitzkrieg

33586.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "War in the Desert" (or the older "Torch", "Western Desert", and "Near East" games). It contains 122 new counters for use with the logistics system.
33586.name: Master Europa 104: Southern Front

33587.name: Master Europa 105: SouthEastern Front
33587.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "Balkan Front". It contains 47 new counters for use with the logistics system and 1 each for the German and Italian OOB.

33588.name: Master Europa 106: First Front
33588.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the game "First to Fight". It contains no counters.

33589.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module covers the games "Narvik" & "Storm over Scandinavia" & "Winter War". It contains 39 new counters for use with the logistics system, and 1 for use with the naval system .
33589.name: Master Europa 107: Northern Fronts

33590.name: Master Europa 108: Red Army
33590.description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module provides the player with all the materials needed to make use of the latest research available on the entire Soviet military during the years 1939-1945.
Over 6,000 counters provide a complete replacement Soviet military and production structure. These counters will work with the existing GRD products, but avoid the "gaps" where the new games have not filled in.
A special set of rules allows this module to be integrated into either Master Europa modules 101 or 102 without difficulty.

33591.name: Master Europa 109: Partisan!
33591.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module provides the player with a complete set of rules, Orders of Appearances, and counters to allow the player to simulate the underground war in the West and Balkans from 1940-1945. It contains 570 counters for use with the system.

33592.name: Master Europa 110: Strategic Air War
33592.description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module provides the entire German production system, Orders of Battle and counters presenting the RAF (and its Commonwealth country counterparts), the Luftwaffe from 1939-1945, and the United States Army Air Force in the Mediterranean and Northern European Theaters from 1942-1945. It contains 1,909 counters (625 Luftwaffe, 650 RAF, 514 USAAF, and 124 target and special markers for the Germans).

33593.name: Master Europa 111: War at Sea
33593.description:
Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series.

This module provides a comprehensive naval system for all of Master Europa, and includes a map showing the full Atlantic and Indian oceans. The module contains ship cards showing the fleets of every European nation, the US Atlantic fleet, Brazil, India, and the Japanese fast carrier fleet. The module covers from Sept. 1939 to June 1945. It contains 1046 ship cards and 887 new counters: 195 showing the carrier and land based aircraft, 189 coastal defense positions, 146 Task force Markers, and 357 for use in the interlocking convoy system.

33594.name: Master Europa 112: Grand Master Europa
33594.description: Master Europa is a complete set of rules and charts replacing those in the games of the Europa series. This module provides a consolidated and unified set of rules (General and National) and charts to allow all games in the series to be united and played as a single mass. You must have the other modules (except 108) for this to be used.

33595.description:
9tka ("dziewiątka" = "nine" in Polish) is played on a 9x9 square grid, divided into nine 3x3 sections. Each of the sections starts with a neutral token placed at random in it, but not on any of the squares that comprise the outer ring of the game board.

In the first phase of play, players take turns placing their tokens around the outside edge of the board until each board edge has nine tokens next to it (one per square), so that a total of 36 tokens have been placed around the board.

In the second phase of play, players take turns moving their tokens into the board in a straight line until they stop due to another token blocking further forward movement. A token can become blocked from even entering the board.

After all player tokens have moved onto the board (or blocked from entering), scoring takes place: For each of the nine 3x3 regions, the player with the most tokens in it earns a point. (In case of tie, no one earns the point for the region.) In case of a tie, the tied player who moved last wins.

Online Play

igGameCenter (real-time)
33595.name: 9tka

33596.name: Idiot's Pursuit
33596.description:
Subtitle: The satirical trivia set

A set of 56 expansion cards for trivia games, intended to be used to spike the decks of other trivia games.
Categories:
God & Creation
Hitler & The Gang
Sex & Minorities
Aliens & Other Animals
Sports & Lesions
Excrement & Showbiz

Sample Questions:
Q: What do American Indian paratroopers shout?
A: Custer!

Q: What builds strong bodies 12 ways?
A: 12 kinds of regular exercise.

Q: What does a second throw into the ring to stop a boxing match?
A: A .38 [pistol]

33597.name: Frog
33597.description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin and contain small wooden pieces.

A flicking game for 2 to 4 jolly jumping players. Contains 4 sets of wooden frogs and matching coloured flicking disks. All players go simultaneously in an attempt to be the first to flick their frog back into the pond (the empty tin)

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (17-08-2009) --!>

33598.name: Victory in the Galaxy
33598.description:
Small game, published on Tactics magazine in Japan.
Though it is really a small magazine game, this game covers all aspects of galactic warfare.
The key point is that at the start every power has really very limited capacity. Because of this reason, the small map is really big enough for expanding, and even the regular capacity for other game is really a special ability.
Very clever design.
But unfortunately even in Japan this game is neglected, because this game is attached with not the boardgame issue but with the RPG issue.
If you found this in the auction and you love sci-fi boardgames, please take it.

33599.description:
A stormy, westerly wind buffets the vessel of the black pirate towards a treasure island! The notorious Vladimir Windjammer, however, has already pillaged the treasures ... and positions his cannon.

Contents:
2 pirate vessels
2 cannons
4 cannon balls
2 sets of bellows
2 pirates' islands
10 treasure tiles
1 wind die
1 set of game instructions

NOTE: Does not require a copy of "The Black Pirate/Der Schwarze Pirat" to play.
boardgameversion: Haba Multilingual edition with German cover
33599.name: Der schwarze Pirat: Das Duell
boardgamepodcastepisode: TPGC - Episode #65 - Klask, Pharaohs Gulo Gulo and Pirate Blast
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82

33600.description:
Minis-based game using a generous selection of 1/72 miniatures, provided, depicting the fierce battle that transpired between Russian and Livonian knights on the ice of Lake Peipus in 1242, in Estonia. Comes with 72 very high quality plastic soldiers, rules of play, several play aids and a few cardboard tents that need to be cut out and assembled. Packaging is in Russian and English but the game is available with rules in German, French, Spanish, Italian and Dutch.

This game is one of four in the Age of Battles medieval series.

Box contents include:
2 Sets of miniatures
- Russian Knights: 42 figures and 2 horses (8001, these are the same as Italeri 6023 but in gold)
- Livonian Knights: 33 figures and 9 horses (8016)
1 Exclusive Catholic priest miniature (silver)
1 Exclusive Orthodox priest miniature (gold)
10 Regiment stands
10 Regiment cards
1 Marker
2 Rulers
1 Angle pattern
1 Rule book
1 Historic Description booklet with Priest characteristics
1 D20 die
3 Sheets of Paper cut-out tents w/instructions
Flag stickers

Zvezda 8202
33600.name: Age of Battles: 1242 – Battle of Lake Peipus

33601.name: Gotcha
33601.description:
Gotcha is a board game created in the 1980's by a division of a jewelery company (Roset by Reid) based in Medicine Hat, Alberta, Canada.

The goal of the game is to create rows of 5 chips in your color across a board divided up into rows of colored and numbered squares. On his turn, the player will play one of 5 cards from his hand of cards, each of which have a number and a color on them. The information on this card indicates a limited set of squares on the board matching the color and number on which a chip can be placed. There are also 2 special kinds of cards: Wild cards which allow a chip to be placed anywhere, and Gotcha cards which can be used to remove an opponent's chip from the board.

A round is over once a player has created 2 rows of 5 chips. Each row of 5 garners 50 points. Several rounds are played until one player reaches 500 points and is declared the winner.

This game can also be played in 2 or 3 teams of 2 players each.

33602.name: The Eternity Game
33602.description:
The Eternity Game is a Biblical trivia game for players ages 12 and up. Players answer questions in one of 5 different categories: Characters, Words, History, Geography, and Miscellaneous, and these questions are in 3 levels of difficulty: Easy, Harder, or Hardest.

The goal is to be the first person to move their token across the board to reach the space indicating "Eternity with Jesus". A player simply answers a question taken from one of the hundreds of question cards corresponding to the color of the space their token is on. The color of the space indicates the question's category and the number on the space indicates the difficulty level of the question. If answered correctly, the player rolls the die and moves accordingly. Should a player be unable to answer a question, the player on their next turn may attempt a lower level of question in the same category.

This game can be played in teams. There are also "Advanced Play" rules, in which the die is not used. In this rule set, once a player answers a question correctly, the token is moved ahead on the board the same number of spaces as the level answered (1, 2, or 3), and the player retains her turn until an incorrect answer is given.

33603.description:
Call to Arms is the second supplement for Lightning Strike, completing the space-based rules set with provisions for advanced ECM, minefields, unit variants and space stations. In addition to twenty-four new CEGA and Jovian units, vehicles used by the neutral Mercurian Merchant Guild are also presented. Within these covers you will find:


Full rules and data cards for fielding the exo-armors, fighters and warships of Jupiter, Earth and Mercury;



Advanced rules for new weapons, cargo and low orbit battles;



Two full-color counter sheets


DP9-318, 32 pages +counters

SRP $15.95US/$17.50Can

NOTE: Call to Arms is not a stand-alone game. You will need to own Lightning Strike in order to play it.

Expands:

Lightning Strike
33603.name: Call to Arms

boardgamehonor: 2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Winner
2008 Origins Awards Best Children’s, Family or Party Game Winner
33604.description:
Say Anything is a light-hearted game about what you and your friends think. It gives you the chance to settle questions that have been hotly debated for centuries. For instance, "What is the most overrated band of all time?" or "Which celebrity would be the most fun to hang out with for a day?" So dig deep into your heart or just come up with something witty - this is your chance to Say Anything!

How to Play
1) Ask a question from the card you draw. For example:
- If you could have a "BIG" anything, what would it be?
- What's the most important invention of the last century?
- Which website would be hardest to live without?
- What's the best activity for a first date?
- What's the worst thing to say to a cop after getting pulled over?

2) Everyone else writes an answer and throws it face-up on the table as fast as possible. No duplicate answers are allowed!

3) Secretly choose your favorite response using a genuine state of the art SELECT-O-MATIC 5000:









4) Everyone else has two betting tokens to bet on which answer you chose. They can bet both tokens on one answer or split them between two different answers.

Who Will Like This Game?
Say Anything is a pure party game. It was designed to get a party started as quickly as possible by prompting people to talk about interesting things and to make ridiculous statements. If you are looking for great social interaction and lots of laughs, then you will probably enjoy playing Say Anything.

History
Say Anything was designed by Dominic Crapuchettes & Satish Pillalamarri. It was first work-shopped by game designers at Protospiel 2004 and refined at Protospiel 2005, PowWow 2005, the GoF 2005 - 2007, and weekly game nights at the Looney Labs.
boardgameversion: North Star Games edition with 4 awards
North Star Games edition with 5 awards
33604.name: Say Anything
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGB Volume 53 - Session Reviews: Ticket To Ride: The Card Game, Say Anything, and Pizza Box Baseball
BGWS 053 – Say Anything
GameBreak Audio: Episode #002 - Going, going, gone!
GameBreak: Episode #002 - Going, going, gone!
I've Been Diced! episode 10: Gateway games
Portal Anniversary Spectacular Episode Three: Revenge of Lloyd Dobler
The Spiel #67 - Party On!
The Spiel #68 - That's A Wrap - 2008 Holiday Gift Guide
TPGC - Episode #41 - Say Anything and Schmovie

33605.description:
The rules of 'The Bendy Banana Company' clearly state: "Absolutely NO monkeys are allowed in the Warehouse", but as co-supervisor you were sure that the rules didn't apply to you. Now The Boss is coming for an impromptu inspection, so you must race against your opponent to be the first to retrieve your Monkey and return it to your Loading Bay, before The Boss arrives!

Monkey Dash is a two player strategy game, in which players spend action points to move their Supervisor and Monkey, and to manipulate the Banana Crates to build a pathway across the board.

The game requires you to employ a wide range of tactics, constantly modify your plans to balance offensive and defensive play, based upon the actions of your opponent.

Two variants ship with the game: Pure Skill, removes all luck from the game, and Advanced, introduces a new banana skin playing piece, adding a new twist to the game.

Monkey Dash launched at the UK Games Expo 2009, where it received the public vote for Best New Strategy Game.
33605.name: Monkey Dash

33606.name: Voltaire
33606.description:
Voltaire is a word game for one (or two) players. The purpose of the game is to cross words, aiming at placing all the letters on the grid.

The player draws at random 10 of the 48 letter tiles, then forms a two- to nine-letter word on the grid. The player then draws the same number of pieces as the letters played, so as to still have 10 letters at their disposal. A new word is formed, adding horizontally or vertically, to the previous word. And so on. The player continues placing words, with the goal being to dispose of all 48 letters. (Parallel words are allowed providing all letters form a word. Also, two words should always be separated by a free square.)

Difficulty Levels
To make the game easier, take out a number of pieces, taking care to remove as many vowels as consonants. To make a harder game: before starting, draw one or several letters and place them anywhere on the grid, blank side up. These will be dead squares, as in a crossword puzzle. OR you can reveal the letters, then "cross words according to the normal rule, incorporating the pieces already disposed on the grid."

Game contents:
Wooden game board with 9x9 grid and grooves along each edge to hold letter tiles, 48 wooden letter tiles (letters of the alphabet plus one joker).

33607.name: Jim Prentice Electric Football
33607.description: 1950s era Electric Football game. Players select offensive play and defensive formation and press buttons. Light bulbs light up a chart on the board to indicate the result of the play and yardage gained. A metal marker is moved along the edge of the "field" to indicate line of scrimmage and line to gain.

33608.name: The Denbury Resources Oil Game
33608.description:
[From the "Rules of the Game" booklet]:

OBJECTIVE
The object of the Oil Game is to add the most oil reserves by taking carbon dioxide from Jackson Dome to the old oil fields in the region.

Each player "transports" carbon dioxide along the pipeline by moving his/her token along the pipeline and claims the tertiary oil reserves from each oil field that is reached.

The winner is the player who either accumulates the most oil or reaches the winning target for the number of competitors playing.

Remember that this game differs from the real world because Denbury had the only carbon dioxide source in the area. Effectively, it's like playing this game with only one player!

-
-

[comment by tcanderson71, an oil geologist in Wyoming]: Actually, this is very much like the real world -- here in Wyoming, there is only one current CO2 supply, owned and controlled by ExxonMobil, located in the LaBarge Field in southwestern Wyoming. It feeds into a CO2 pipeline delivering it to Chevron in Rangely Field in northwest Colorado, then Anadarko Petroleum at Monell Field and Merit Energy in the Lost Soldier and Wertz Fields (south-central Wyoming), and finally to Anadarko at the Salt Creek Field in east-central Wyoming.

33609.description: 1950's era electronic baseball game. Players press buttons that determine the pitch (good, bad) and the batter action (swing, take). Balls and strikes are called by light bulbs lighting up. Hits are determined by an electric motor spinner. Pegs are moved on the board to indicate base runners, balls, strikes, and outs.
33609.name: Jim Prentice Electric Baseball Model 505

33610.name: Prosperity
33610.description: A cross between Life and Monopoly with a Monopoly styled board. This was self-published and has a very groovy 70s cover style and amateur feel to it. You basically are trying to get enough money to be debt free and own a home (no remaining mortgage left). First one able to do it wins. there are some options on who you can control how many dice you roll (normally it is two, but you can pay money to allow you to roll only one or three). Other than that, it is pretty luck-oriented with Paydays, Inheritance, and Jackpots you can hit.

33611.description:
New Special Edition Game Soundtrack for Last Night on Earth features 16 tracks of music created specifically for the game. This includes the entire original soundtrack plus five new songs inspired by upcoming expansions. The CD features new artwork and liner notes from the composer and two exclusive new game cards only available with the Special Edition Soundtrack.

Guitar - Force a zombie to re-roll any number of it's fight dice.

Dance of the Dead - Roll a d6 and remove that many Zombies, all remaining zombies may move one space.
33611.name: Last Night on Earth Special Edition Soundtrack CD
boardgamefamily: Last Night on Earth Game Engine

33612.name: Pocky Shock
33612.description: The game is shaped like a box of Pocky, a favorite snack in Japan. Two of the Pockys in the box are spring-loaded and pulling them will cause all of the Pockys to fly out. Players take turns pulling Pockys; if you pull one of the spring-loaded ones, you lose.

33613.name: Swimming with Sharks
33613.description:
Swimming with Sharks is a strategy game where players are controlling either Swimmer pieces or Shark pieces. Each player has 5 movement points to spend each turn, divided up among their pieces. The Swimmer side also has a Boat piece. Each piece has a movement cost.

When pieces move, they must go in two directions (like a Knight in Chess). If a piece can move 4 spaces, it can move 1 in one direction and 3 in another, or 2 and 2.

The object for the Swimmers is to have at least one Swimmer make it to shore on the opposite side of the board. The Sharks must prevent all Swimmers from making it.

The Boat is a protector, and as long as a Swimmer is in an adjacent space, a Shark can not take the piece.

There are 3 spaces marked with a Star. When a player moves their piece onto the Star space, they may draw a card.

Cards typically consist of value amounts you can add to your movement for a turn. There are a number of special cards that can affect either or both teams. Players may hold as many cards as they like. Movement cards have no penalty to play, but special cards require the use of some movement points in order to be played.

33614.name: Adventurer: Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 26: Teaching Games
33614.description:
K.R.Bourgoine’s Adventurer is a fast paced fantasy card game, where players assume the role of one of 4 heroes in search of the deadly vampire, Count Lodrac. Take turns to be the first hero to reach the crypt deep within the castle and defeat the Count to win the game. Sound simple? Well it is. Sound fun? You bet it is!

The 80 beautifully illustrated cards represent rooms within the castle, magical weapons, dangerous monsters, traps, and those trusty wooden stakes that the heroes must use to destroy the vile Vampire Lord.

K.R.Bourgoine’s Adventurer takes about 10-15 minutes to play and is suitable for 1-4 players Ages 8 and up. Players can continue their adventures with a variety of Adventurer Expansion Decks, each available separately.

33615.name: Trollskatten
33615.description: Trollskatten (English, The Troll Treasure) is a Swedish children's game. The object of the game is to find the key to the treasure chest containing the troll's gold, while avoiding the evil troll and his traps. The first player to reach the gold wins.

33616.name: Freebooters
33616.description:
A cutlass slashes through the sea breeze, smoke fills the air, a shout of "prepare for boarders!" echoes across the water, two ships pull closer as men run to the rails. You are about to enter the world of FreeBooters. Pirate adventure through the sea fights, fort battles, sacking of towns, and battles for treasure and fame. Can you as the Captain of the fort prevent the crew from rescuing their freebooter captain? As a freebooter, can you get your treasure back to your ship through the jungle, avoiding the enemy ambush? Do you risk crossing Danger Falls or hack your way through the jungle facing quicksand and gators?

Fight your way across the seas, jungles, towns, islands, and forts of the Caribbean in this game of sword fights and adventure…

Freebooters showcases man to man sword fights in the style of Worthington's popular COWBOYS game. Cards will reflect the variables of the fighting style of the golden age of piracy as well as some of the personality unique to this time. Players assume the roles of freebooter captains and their crews, opposing the English, Spanish, and American soldiers and sailors pitted against them.

The game includes plastic pirates crew, captains, multiple hard mounted game boards, cards, and much more, all produced with some of the highest quality game components available.

33617.name: What's Up Doc? The Bugs Bunny Game
33617.description:
Honey Bunny (TM) wants you to bring your friends along to Bugs Bugs Bunny's house, you will stop and pick up a birthday present from many of his Looney Tunes (TM) friends.

Object: To collect a present from all of Bugs Bunny's friends and bring them to his birthday party.

33618.name: Strive For Five: Old Testament
33618.description:
From the box:

Strive For Five is a competitive educational game that is fun for the whole family.

Each card starts with a true or false question. The correct answer will win you the right to play the card. Each youth and pre-school card has 5 multiple choice questions (per side). Each Adult card has 5 questions (per side) with an alphabetical clue to the answer. Can be played with or without the clue.

You must "Strive For Five" correct answers because the person who answers the 5th question, wins the card. If the turn is passed to you on the 5th question, you could win the card with only one correct answer, keeping the excitement level high.

Youth, pre-school, adult and expert cards can be played in the same game for family play.

33619.description:
Advanced Squad Leader System (ASL) compatible - Battles between the German 2nd Marine Infantry Division and the British VIII and XII Corps. 6-19 April 1945.

Contents:
20 Scenarios
5 Overlays
32 Special Counters needed for the play of the scenarios
Historical Background

ASL rulebook, British and German counters, and ASL mapboards needed.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader




Scenarios:
TOT 13: Learning the Law of the Soldier
TOT 14: Panzer-Teufel Strikes Back
TOT 15: The Steel-Eyed Boys
TOT 16: The Strassengabel Strongpoint
TOT 17: Last Stand at Westen
TOT 18: The Aller Waltz
TOT 19: Liebe Elefriede
TOT 20: Threat to the Bridgehead
TOT 21: Tony - Take the Bridge - Out!
TOT 22: Rock of Resistance
TOT 23: This Close to the Sharp End
TOT 24: Across the Aller
TOT 25: Franzen's Roadblock
TOT 26: Free-for-All
TOT 27: First Light of Dawn
TOT 28: Black Friday
TOT 29: Tiger Hunt
TOT 30: Right Hook at Sudkampen
TOT 31: Push Comes to Shove
TOT 32: Denoument
TOT tB: Marine Ambush
33619.name: Time on Target: April 1945 – At The Sharp End

33620.name: Chicago Cribbage
33620.description:
About the Game (from the Outset Media Website and the Package)

• Ages 10 and up
• 2-4 Players

An exciting twist to the traditional game of cribbage, where players can demand a recut, stall their opponents, trade hands, and even prevent 'fifteens' from scoring. At the beginning of each game players are dealt seven special cards to be used during that game, adding a new level of strategy and fun. Have you been dealt lousy cards? No worries! Play the right card at the right time and watch your luck change instantly.

Contents

• Illustrated 54 card deck
• 28 special cards
• Instruction booklet

33621.name: Yahtzee: Dragon Ball Z
33621.description:
Like the classic Yahtzee game, you're rolling for various dice combinations. Match Heroes - SS Goku, SS Trunks, and SS Vegeta or Villains - Android 20, Android 17 or Frieza 5th form to earn tiles. The tiles add a different twist to the game, influencing your strategy plan. They may provide you with Dragonball Z Radar or give you an extra roll or two of the dice. You could even lose tiles to Perfect Cell. Pick a Villain tile and you'll have to battle to keep it.

The more tiles you earn, the more points you'll score. Roll Five of a Kind - that's Yahtzee, and you get to collect the Dragonball Tile along with any tiles collected by Perfect Cell. Earn the most points and you win.

This unique combination of battle, chance and strategy makes every game exciting.

33622.description:
Vencer o Morir (to win or die) covers the largest single battle of the Chaco War in December, 1933.
Known as the Battle of Campo Via, the Paraguayan’s had massed (with the knowledge of the Bolivians’ air reconnaissance) twice as many divisions aimed at the thinly defended lines and no Bolivian reserves. Just north of Alihuata, the Bolivian lines simply dangled. The warnings Kundt received from his own commanders along the front were all ignored. Fearing the worse, the Bolivian commander, Banzer, ordered part of his
artillery, his tanks and ammo to be moved south to Saavedra.
The battle began Dec. 3 and ended on the 12th.

Game Scale:
The map scale is about 2 miles per hex.
Each combat unit is a battalion sized unit. HQ’s are represented by a Paraguayan or Bolivian flag.
A game turn represents one day.
Tanks and Armor cars represent one of each type.
Artillery are batteries.
33622.name: Vencer o Morir: Kundt's Pocket at Camp Via, Dec. 1933

33623.description:
Larry, a.k.a. Blöff, is a bluffing card game along the lines of Cheat and Bullshit in which players take turns laying cards into a central stack and making claims about what they played. As long as the next person in line doesn't call their bluff, they're off the hook!

To start a round, each player receives a hand of 5-12 cards, depending on the number of players; cards range in value from -2 to 7, with a handful of special cards also being present. A limit card shows a 7, with players playing clockwise. On a player's turn, he lays one card face-down on the table, adds the number on that card to the sum announced by the previous player (if any), then announces the new sum; the player can play any card and state any sum, as long as it's not higher than seven. The next player has the option of playing a card (under the same circumstances) or calling the previous player's claim. If he does this, reveal all of the cards and sum them, with action cards counting as zero. If the claimed sum is correct, the doubter draws two cards from the deck and starts the next round; if not, the previous player draws two cards — even if he played honestly on his turn. As soon as you make a claim, you're responsible for what everyone played before you!

Actions cards can be played face-up for their action, and they allow you to give one card from your hand to another player, force someone to draw two cards, force an opponent to play her next numbered card face-up, or change the direction of play while simultaneously flipping the limit card; when first flipped, the limit changes to 5 and players must now abide by that limit.

The deck also contains three gloating "Larry" cards, and if one or three Larrys are in the central stack, then a player's claim of a sum is always correct!

When a player runs out of cards, the next player can doubt the total or let it stand. the player who went out scores 2 points, while everyone else loses points equal to the number of little Larry symbols on cards still in their hand. After three rounds, the player with the highest score wins.
33623.name: Larry

33624.description:
Every card contains two easy, two medium and two hard questions. Your die roll decides, what difficulty level question you will get! If you answer correctly, you may throw the die again, but you also get to advance on a bonus track, where you get to steal points from your opponents, you get easier questions ect. The die roll resolves your destiny ... but your own knowledge seals it!

In Finnish: Jokainen kortti sisältää kaksi helppoa, kaksi keskivaikeaa ja kaksi vaikeaa kysymystä. Nopanheittosi ratkaisee, minkä tasoisen kysymyksen saat! Jos vastaat oikein, saat heittää noppaa uudelleen, mutta pääset myös etenemään bonusradalle, jolla pääset varastamaan pisteitä vastapelaajilta, saat helpompia kysymyksiä jne. Nopanheitto ratkaisee kohtalosi ... mutta oma tietämyksesi sinetöi sen!
33624.name: Trivial Pursuit Deluxe

33625.name: Indicios
33625.description:
Indicios
The game of the 10 clues.

Two teams must guess the secret word on the card with as few clues as possible. The board consists in 4 tracks, two for each team. The fewer number of clues needed to guess the word the more spaces your team can move along the track.

The team that gets 400 points first wins the game.
